FuncDef:
The emdi bind slot command binds boards to a board group.
The undo emdi bind slot command cancels the binding relationship between boards and a board group.
By default, all EMDI-capable boards are bound to the board group named _default_ but no board is bound to other board groups.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot ID of a board.
The name is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
As a distributed board detection solution, the EMDI detection solution requires the configuration of boards for EMDI detection. After a board group is created, run the emdi bind slot command to bind EMDI-capable boards to a board group for EMDI distributed board detection.
Prerequisites
A board group has been created using the emdi lpu-group command.
Precautions
The same board can be bound to different board groups.
Only EMDI-capable boards can be bound to a board group. The supported EMDI-capable boards include the LPUF-50/LPUF-50-L/LPUI-21-L/LPUI-51-L/LPUF-51/LPUF-51-B/LPUI-51/LPUI-51-B/LPUI-51-S/LPUS-51/LPUF-101/LPUF-101-B/LPUI-101/LPUI-101-B/LPUS-101/LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-CM/LPUF-120/LPUF-120-B/LPUF-120-E/LPUI-102-E/LPUI-120/LPUI-120-B/LPUI-120-L/LPUI-52-E/LPUI-120-E/LPUI-120-CM/LPUF-240/LPUF-240-B/LPUF-240-E/LPUI-240/LPUI-240-B/LPUI-240-CM/LPUI-240-L/LPUF-480/LPUF-480-B/LPUI-480/LPUI-480-B/LPUI-480-L/LPUF-480-E/LPUI-480-CM/LPUI-200/LPUI-200-L/LPUF-200/LPUF-200-B/LPUI-1T/LPUI-1T-B/LPUI-1T-L/LPUI-1T-CM/LPUI-2T/LPUI-2T-B/LPUI-2T-CM/LPUF-481/LPUF-402-E/LPUI-241/LPUI-241-B/LPUI-241-CM//LPUF-241/LPUF-241-E/LPUF-52/LPUF-1T-E/LPUI-1T-CM/LPUF-1T-L.
/5880/does not support outbound EMDI detection.
